ast.name: D'Oh! Homer wants his Duff
ast.comment: This app is a demo app that is used to show how to make an interesting game for Windows 8 and Web presentation.

decls.name: score
decls.comment: Score is a number that stores the score for presentation to the user.

decls.name: sprite set
decls.comment: Sprite set holds the images used in the game.  In this game the images are the same, which requires a little trick in the code.

decls.name: bTappedBoard
decls.comment: Boolean to detect the first time the board is tapped.  This is used on the start screen.

decls.name: Whack Image
decls.comment: This is a sprite that allows me to hold the Image to be whacked

decls.name: Start Text
decls.comment: Start Text shown on the initial screen or board (not the same as page)

decls.name: n Level Control
decls.comment: This is used to control the level being presented and is in the gameloop and gameplay event

decls.name: n Whack Image 1 Count
decls.comment: A number that detects the number of Donuts hit by the player

decls.name: n Whack Image 2 Count
decls.comment: A number that detects the number of times that Whack Image 2 hit by the player

decls.name: Replay Button3
decls.comment: This is the sprite variable that holds the replay button, required so that there is a tap event assigned to that particular sprite.

decls.name: Start Button
decls.comment: Sprite to hold the start button

decls.name: txtScoring
decls.comment: Is  a sprite that holds the text for the score.  Normally I would use the Heads Up Display library but in the press of time used the sprite.
